div.div: and suture then takes over, keeping
track of every started service, restarting
it when needed if an error occurred.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 506px; margin-left: 32px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
div.div: each service is implemented as a sub-command. The binary essentially calls itself with the right arguments and the side effect is that a
service is started. The service will then be monitored by Suture.

div.div: the runtime is a service in itself. Starting an
oCIS instance will start a runtime service.
